div.translation: Veneration to the one who wears the half moon, whose colour in his throat has the splendour of the jewels [on the hood] of the serpent-king: to Hara, garlanded with skulls that are as bright as clouds, who holds a single-tipped spear trembling for the slaying of the Daitya [=Andhaka].

lg.l:
devāri sūdanaṃ skandanaṃ skadanaṃ
skandam skadanam

div.translation: Agastya asks Skanda, the holder of the spear of knowledge, appeased, the child born from Śaṅkara, slayer of the Gods’ enemies:
Agastya said

lg.l:
sapta janmāni janmani janmasu
vipraś ca viprastu vipraścā

div.translation: “O Bhagavān, by seeing you a good rebirth [comes to pass] even for a man of the lowest caste. Then, once this one falls from Heaven, he is reborn as a Brahmin for seven rebirths
Therefore, o Lord, you are compassionate towards all beings; for this reason, tell us/me concisely the Dharma that is beneficial to all.

lg.l:
devena
kathitāḥ kathitā
kila kilaḥ kilā

te ca
śrutās tvayā śrutā tvayā śrutvā tvayā śrutvāskṛyā śrutās vayā
sarve

div.translation: It is said that many kinds of religious norms have been taught by the god for the goddess, and they have all been heard by you. For this reason, I ask you:

lg.l:
kiṃpradhānāḥ
śive dharmāḥ śivādharmo śivedharmā śivadharmāḥ

div.translation: What are the main religious rules with reference to Śiva, and what are the features of Śiva’s teachings? By which procedure is Śiva satisfied when he is worshipped in the liṅga? Śiva is satisfied when he is worshipped in the liṅga following which procedure?

lg.l:
vidyādānaṃ ca
dānānāṃ sarveṣām
In #PT75 "dānānāṃ sarveṣām" is inverted: "sarveṣām dānānāṃ".

div.translation: Moreover, it is said that the gift of knowledge is the most important of all gifts; and it has been described in the Revelation for no others than for the best among the twice-born:

lg.l:
jñeyaṃ katividhaṃ
tac ca ta ca

div.translation: By means of what ritual procedure is merit deriving from this [practice] brought about for all varṇas? And [divided into] how many [different] types will this unsurpassable gift of knowledge be known?

lg.l:
kāni
puṇyāni kṛtveha karmaṇi kṛtveha kṛtvaiva karmāṇi

gṛhiṇaḥ svargatāḥ gṛhasthasvarggāt gṛhiṇaḥ svargiṇaḥ
punaḥ

yogaṃ
vindanti śāṅkaram vidanti śaṅkaram vindanti śaṅkaram vindanti sākaram

div.translation: By means of what meritorious actions done in this world do the householders who have gone to Heaven perform the yoga of Śaṅkara, once they are born again in the human world?

lg.l:
svādhyāyo
dhyānam eva ca dhyānanirmmitaḥ dhyānanirvṛttiḥ

div.translation: The practice of rituals (karmayajña), the practice of askesis (tapoyajña), self-study [of the Vedas] (svādhyāya), meditation (dhyāna), and the practice of knowledge (jñānayajña): these are known as the five great religious practices (mahāyajña).
And, among these practices, which one is remembered as the best? And of what kind is that fruit [obtained] from gifting to those who rejoice in these five practices?

lg.l: tat sādhanāḥ katividhā sādhanā katividhā sādhanāni kativā sādhanāni katidhā

div.translation: And of what kind are the divisions of Dharma and Adharma said [to be]? Of how many kinds are the instruments for their realization, and the paths belonging to (leading to) them?

lg.l:
āyātānāṃ punaḥ āyātānāṃ puna āgatānām puna
kṣitau

div.translation: Which distinctive marks arise through a karman that is left to be experienced for the inhabitants of heaven and hell, once they have come back to earth?

lg.l: garbhādiduḥkha phenāḍhyān phenāḍhyaḥ phenāḍhya phenāṭha phenādvā

div.translation: How do people endowed with a body free themselves from the terrible ocean of transmigration, agitated with the waves of Dharma and Adharma, abundant with the foam that is the anguish [experienced] by the embryos and so on?

lg.l:
iti
sañcoditaḥ skandaḥ sañcoditaskanda sañcoditaṃ skandas sañcoditaskandas

div.translation: Thus impelled Skanda, the one who illustrates the contents of all queries, [leader of] the great [Gaṇa’s] army (mahāsena), after having revered Maheśvara, replied
[by expounding] what bestows the fruit of Heaven and liberation, what saves from the sea of hells, namely the treatise called Śivadharmottara, that has been taught by the Lord.
Skanda said
All teachings have faith at their beginning, they are established as having faith in the middle and at the end and the basements are grounded on faith, teachings are said to be just faith,

lg.l:
śruti śrutiṃ mātra rasāḥ ratāḥ rasā
sūkṣmāḥ

div.translation: Having an essence that is nothing but Revelation, subtle, dealing with prakṛti, puruṣa, and the Lord, [these teachings] are seized only through faith, not with the hand nor with the eye. Check Niśvāsakārikā 34.17 – Note parallel in the DP with tarka, referring to the 3 pramāṇas

lg.l:
kāya kāla kleśair
na bahubhir makhaiś caivā

div.translation: Not by means of many bodily afflictions, nor by heaping up wealth is a subtle teaching understood, not even by the gods, if they are devoid of faith.

lg.l:
śraddhā
jñānaṃ jñāna jānaṃ dānaṃ
hutaṃ tapaḥ

śraddhā
śraddhātaḥ
svargaś ca mokṣaś
svargaṃ ca mokṣaṃ
svargomokṣaś
svargaś ca mokṣaṃ
ca

div.translation: Faith is the supreme, subtle Dharma; faith is knowledge, oblation and askesis; faith is both heaven and emancipation; faith is this entire universe.
